comments.value:
Hi Jamie, We've just been looking into the photo gallery page, specifically the image sliders, with javascript turned off and noticed that on pages such as this one: http://www.london2012.com/photos/2009/08/aquatics-centre-roof-64877.php the bottom image slider does not function properly when javascript is turned off. It seems that are are two inline styles which must have been copied in from the static html templates Martin and I sent to you :
which means that the right hand arrow slider control is always being shown, when it should disappear if javascript is turned off. Removing the 'style="display:block" will remedy this problem. The other problem is there is no horizontal scrollbar on the image slider due to the following code:
Removing the style="overflow: hidden;" on this div will mean the horizontal scroll bar appears when javascript is turned off. I didn't notice this happening on other pages such as http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/ which works as expected so I'm not sure if this is happening else where or not. Thanks,

subject: Photo pages /  no javascript / cogapp amends
description:
Hi Jamie, We've just been looking into the photo gallery page, specifically the image sliders, with javascript turned off and noticed that on pages such as this one: http://www.london2012.com/photos/2009/08/aquatics-centre-roof-64877.php the bottom image slider does not function properly when javascript is turned off. It seems that are are two inline styles which must have been copied in from the static html templates Martin and I sent to you :
which means that the right hand arrow slider control is always being shown, when it should disappear if javascript is turned off. Removing the 'style="display:block" will remedy this problem. The other problem is there is no horizontal scrollbar on the image slider due to the following code:
Removing the style="overflow: hidden;" on this div will mean the horizontal scroll bar appears when javascript is turned off. I didn't notice this happening on other pages such as http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/ which works as expected so I'm not sure if this is happening else where or not. Thanks,

Hi Simon,

We've just forced though a new image form SiteEye

This seems to have been  a problem with the connection dropping with SiteEye althoguh we do check we have received a JPG we can't check we have a non-corrupted one (to do that we need a checksum which I don't think SiteEye offer)

thanks

Jamie

* If SiteYye ran the image though a checksum function before uploading the image and then stored that checksum with the image as EXIF data we could then check we have received the whole image successfully. at the other end. As it stands we just have to assume that if we have a file of the smae length with JPG headers then it's OK. If they don't have it in place already they may find it difficult / be reluctant to implement it, but it may be worth asking in passing if they have such a feature, as it means we can re-request any image where the checksum doesn't match.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Md5sum
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simple_file_verification

If you look under the meta data tab on those pages there is a 
navigation-order column

If you give each of your pages a value then they should appear in the 
side nav in that order.

I'd suggest using increments of 10 (ie. 10, 20, 30, 40) so that you 
can add in extra page later without having to reassign values to all 
the other pages.

> Paralympic Athletics (20)
> Boccia (30)

take account of the navigation order values.

I'll open a story in Pivotal for it but #Liz# you'll have to 
prioritise this along with any other tasks tomorrow (unless you want 
to bump it up straight way)

Jamie

We are going to be doing some market research on them and need to work out how many we have in each age group etc.
 
Is it possible to have this by the end of Thursday?

Sent: Tue 01/12/2009 6:24 PM

Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: trying to save changes

Dodgy xcall attached. I think the "unknown xcall" message is because the tags param is being sent as an empty string, not a string array. That's because most of the parameters to this call are not initialised, eg. no path, no template. In fact, the reason that it's a createNewPage xcall at all rather than a savePage is that the id is presumably also uninitialised. So I'm guessing an earlier xcall screwed up the item somehow.
This looks the same as #215. I've commited a workaround, should go with the bundle tonight.
